snippet: It may come as a surprise that floppy disks are still manufactured. But it’s perhaps more surprising The Federal Register still uses them to receive official submissions.
abstract: Government infrastructure experts are hoping that public embarrassments like HealthCare.gov debacle will prompt a closer look at the government’s technological prowess, especially if it might mean getting rid of floppy disks; use of the 3.5-inch plastic storage squares, all but obsolete in United States, are still being used by Federal Register, daily journal of US government.
lead_paragraph: It may come as a surprise that floppy disks are still manufactured. But it’s perhaps more surprising The Federal Register still uses them to receive official submissions.

headline.main: Slowly They Modernize: A Federal Agency That Still Uses Floppy Disks
headline.print_headline: Slowly They Modernize: A Federal Agency That Still Uses Floppy Disks
